In Antwerp 18 feb 1681
N1enwpoort michicl vallego
gisteren heb aen ul gesonden p bode het paxken N.11 omt selve te
expedieren als de voorgaende: sedert den ul aengenamen van i8 des
wel ontfangen, waer door geirne verstaen dat N. 8:9 210 us wel sijn
geworden, hope vervolgens mr. Abram vivians in london sullen
wel ter handt komen N7 is ul niet toegesonden maer een ander cour
gegeven wat wegens de voorgaende passent verneme geirne
In Antwerpen 19 feb 1681
fnicolus John Button
mons. over eenigh dagen heb aen ul gescreven rakende de mee bale die
ul noch onverkoght heeft hier liggen, dat de selve tot 13ƒ a ƒ4 sonde
konnen verkoopen mits daer voor te laten verdienen niet verfloon
en ul heeft daer niet op geantwoort daer over mij verwondere, want de lieden
en willen nmet lanverwaghten, voorders kan ul eanige monsters seiynde
van goede crappen en on beroofde, ick sal de selve seer wel konnen
verkoopen waernae gelieft te reguleeren terwijlen blijve
Brussel Anna marce de dr
In Antweren 17 eb
J desen all een tot advies als dat heden aen ul toesende p voermn
een paxken gemerckt op 2 BM om selve voorts te bestellen op Bergen
henegen aen Jan B. Masson stellende den onkost op sijn Rok
In Antwerpen 20 ferbi
Leuven Joan De Goeder
S in antwoort vanden ul van 17 deser heeft den bode storeels mij de
so 27:19 gebroght volgens op de Rebt gestelt ul vraght volle quitantie
vande selve facture maer ul moet mij dan de perticulier quitan
te rugge sende ul kande selve beneffens de facture in een brief sond
& ick sal ul dat dan in forma wederont senden, rakende ul stael
soo danigh lakens hebbe geen maer salder de naeste weeke bekomen
en ul dan vande nieuste staelen senden terwijlen blijve
In Antwerpen 2 of o6
Leyden Adram scollaert
mijnen leeften is noch bij ul on beantwoort is desen dan alleen tot
advies als dat voor ul laken N. 539 de dammes geboden wort ƒ4 p a contant
den vrint daertoe niet hoogh kan bewilling oversulx gelieft niet nae
te laten mij te adviseeren ul reselutie deswegens als mede oft met
oonen water eenighe nieuwe modecoll lakens sult senden waermedeblij
In Antwerpen 21 feb 1681
Mons Jan B masson
mons celleay neservira que pour vous adviseer que p' ordre de mons
veraghteren ie vous ey envoyez un pacquette IDM p la voyez demad
deros de Brussell contenant un drap de mons. Du mont & un bay
manchester de lesmienes de
pour des frais depaeter tolles & voitures a charrot „ -:15-
de moy pourre compte . ƒ26:15-
comme te temp de caresme est commence, nous attendons deiours
a aultre les novelles marchandisse tellement si vre grace att
besoing quelque chase vous me trouvercy bien pour veujquis que
Je suis
London Wisl. scawen
In Antwarp 22 fob 1681 22
th
S my last to you was on the 18: curitt then omitted to in gure, when the bed
tykes arelanded in london, whither they beopened att the cattome house or no
because I have some thoughts that wee could send laces within the tykes
where fore in case there no danger there in shall follow yd advise & keep
some goods by mee for that purpose: within fowdayes shall send you
the casculation of what I supost to want by next east india sale because
by that time I hope to disposse of a good parlell yett & so remaine
In Antwerp 22 feb 81
London John Loyd
S onthe 4: of I anu. last was to you my last, sence non from you, this
onely to advise you, that because of the hard frost, sence our peoble att
gent have been very neyligent, or rather could not sa well proceed in
makeing the in ordered legaturen as well I could have wished, whoever with
this present milde wheatter they promise mee to finish them speedly
of which I hope to sende you an acctt. pr first: intrim I hope you have recd.
the tijkes bij Adriaen clock & that you forimd them, as also disposed of
the same to content: as I wrott you last have now & then pickt up a
parcell of tykes, butt the winter season beeng over wee forind last
markett day butt few to be sold & within a week or too will be scurey agan
so that in case your order should then come, I should not be able to compleat
itt in a litthe while, where as now I have yett some by mee though most
part disposed off yett for a houndred peees could serve you which if you please
shall be sent you as cheap as possible they are to be hadd nay cheaper then any
other intowne could now provide them & pure good of which exspect yd
advises remaine
In Antwarp 22 feb 1681
London Abram vivian
th
S hij last to you was on the 15: curitt to which referre you sence recd yd of 9 d itt
where by take notice that the bales N. 25 „ 26„ 29 „ 30 be shipt att hull butt
you may name not the mr. Isupose tis John nelson & you may not neglect
to gett the other 3 aboard the same for I want bayes & the others goods
inclosed you have an accompt of charges on 20 bales recd. sence 12 august
in which yd ½ is ƒ1072„6½ are £178„14:4½ for which please to meeke yd
acctt. debt. & ore. for yd of each month sale accordingly you will finde
onder each month noted itt beeng to aggree with my bookes: you have also
under the acctt. of charges a caloulation how the trade renders the reffing
goods beeng rekoned as they cost first pennij which are sold sence except
13 cloathes: now have ordered the 3 bales N.21122 s to be send up from
bruges, where they have been detained becaused of the frost & they will
give mee some suply till the goods aboard nelson be arrived which I pray
god may suceed pr. first you may observe that kersies & bayes do not so
well render as clothes, whoever wee must make itt generall & our
eu stomes beeng so much diminished will make us gaine more I hope
you shall understand my manner of mazeing accompts of sale
& charges & approve of them, as also finde riyh to content, of which
shall be glad to have yd advise whilst by the by desire you to accquant no
bodd y whoe soever of what wee do, or of acctt & keep all thinghs chose private
in closed as so the acctt. of the last packett N.12 which beeng much longer
then ordinary is ordered to be sent by vessel from Bruges except you did
contramand itt I am gladd you have all recd except N8 which by this
time can be with you as asso N.10 they are all don up in one the same
d
manner butt itt will be fore yd advantidge to open euch parcell, or each
p of lace & shew the whole peece att leasstor 3 yd fars, because then itt will
make a greated shew then so narrowly foulded up on the blew paper thought
